div.span: Asheboro City Schools Responds to COVID-19

span.div: ACS is continuing to work with public health officials to monitor the ongoing novel coronavirus (COVID-19) situation. At this time, all public schools are closed to students by Executive Order from Governor Roy Cooper until May 15. Below is a link to our Coronavirus (COVID-19) Resources webpage. We will update this information everyday by 7 p.m.

in NC where all schools met or exceeded
growth two years in a row.

monetary awards to the Class of 2018.
Asheboro City School teachers are in the

div.span: Asheboro City Schools will be a community of excellence where each student graduates globally competitive for college, careers, and citizenship.

We are committed to providing rigorous, individualized, and engaging learning opportunities for all students in a safe and inviting environment to ensure our students can become successful lifelong learners, prepared for global citizenship.

img.title: Martinez Sworn in as Newest Member of the Asheboro City Board of Education
img.alt: Martinez Sworn in as Newest Member of the Asheboro City Board of Education

h3.a: Martinez Sworn in as Newest Member of the Asheboro City Board of Education

span.span: The Asheboro City Board of Education was pleased to welcome Mr. Art Martinez during a virtual swearing in ceremony led by Chairman of the Randolph County Commissioners, Mr. Darryl Frye, on Tuesday, April 7. Click here for more information.

img.title: Joyce Harrington
img.alt: Joyce Harrington: Lifelong Public Servant of Asheboro City Schools

h3.a: Joyce Harrington: Lifelong Public Servant of Asheboro City Schools

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: It was with heavy hearts that the Asheboro City Board of Education accepted the resignation of board member, Mrs. Joyce Harrington, after 34 years of service at their February meeting. Click here to read more!

br.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px

img.title: New Head Football Coach - Blake Brewer
img.alt: Brewer Named AHS Head Football Coach

h3.a: Brewer Named AHS Head Football Coach

div.span: In a special ceremony at Asheboro High School, Mr. Blake Brewer was named the new head football coach for the Blue Comet Varsity Football team. Click here to read more about Mr. Brewer.

img.title: NAMS School of Rock
img.alt: Rockin' Out at the NAMS School of Rock

h3.a: Rockin' Out at the NAMS School of Rock

div.span: If there is one thing that can bring people together, it is a shared appreciation and love for music. For centuries, every known culture has had some form of musical influence. From the biblical Psalms to rock concerts of today, music is a language that transcends all barriers. Over the course of history, people have found commonalities through music.

span.div: Fifth-grade teacher, Ms. Emily Ramon, and Assistant Principal, Ms. Keisha Dawalt, both of Balfour Elementary School believe for many years the school’s narrative has been one of low performance and high poverty. “This simply isn’t true,” said Ms. Dawalt. “Our story – the Balfour Elementary story – is one of student success, hardworking and dedicated teachers, and committed and engaged families. We are at the top of our game and it’s important the community understand Balfour is a high-performing school in our district and across North Carolina.” Click here to read more!

img.title: ACS Participates in Walk to School Day
img.alt: ACS Participates in International Walk to School Day

h3.a: ACS Participates in International Walk to School Day

div.span: Students, families, teachers, and administrators from Asheboro City Schools and Donna Lee Loflin Elementary School joined the Honorable Mayor David Smith, Safe Kids of Randolph County, the Asheboro Fire Department, and the North Carolina Highway Patrol on Wednesday, Oct. 2 to participate in International Walk to School Day.

img.title: Asheboro City Board of Education receiving the Silver Bell Award.
img.alt: Asheboro City Board of Education Earns Silver Bell Award

h3.a: Asheboro City Board of Education Earns Silver Bell Award

span.br: Members of the Asheboro City Board of Education attended the North Carolina School Boards Association (NCSBA) District 5 Meeting in Thomasville on Wednesday, September 19, 2019. Board members received professional development and training via several breakout sessions that were offered. While at the meeting, the Asheboro City Board of Education was presented with a 2019 NCSBA Silver Bell Award. The Silver Bell Award recognizes boards where every member has actively worked towards meeting their 12 hours of training during the July 1 through June 30 timeframe. Vice chairman Phillip Cheek accepted the award on behalf of the board.

div.span: Custom-made electric guitars is project-based learning at its best and it’s exactly what is happening in Mr. Scott Smith’s advanced Technological Design class at Asheboro High School. For the full story, click below!

Mr. Isaac Eli Diaz, a senior at Asheboro High School, is one of 161 high school seniors across the nation to be named a United States Presidential Scholar. This White House Commission on Presidential Scholars selects scholars annually based on their academic success, artistic and technical excellence, essays, school evaluations and transcripts, as well as evident of community service, leadership, and demonstrated commitment to the high ideals.

span.br: Asheboro City Schools is excited to share the Homework Resources page with our families and greater community. Check out the new page here!

span.div: Asheboro City Schools was established in 1905. Located in the heart of North Carolina, Asheboro City Schools serves approximately 4,500 students at eight schools and one five-star, nationally-accredited Early Childhood Development Center. The district is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS CASI).

div.span: Asheboro City Schools

does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The Title IX Coordinator has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies. 1126 South Park Street Asheboro, NC 27203 336-625-5104.
